p: Clinically, chikungunya‐associated GBS resembles GBS associated with other infections such as Campylobacter jejuni, presenting with symmetrical, bilateral flaccid weakness, often with paraesthesia and/or cranial nerve palsy. 109 The 4 reports in the literature detailing the time interval between chikungunya infection and onset of neurological features describe a prodrome of 3 to 17 days, compatible with a parainfectious or postinfectious syndrome (Table 2). 67, 68, 73
